qas.question: How many years ago did migrations of people happen in the Pacific area?
By what means did locale people travel between Pacific islands?
How many islands are in the Tuvalu group?
On how many of Tuvalu's islands did people live?
What is the native language meaning of Tuvalu?

context: The origins of the people of Tuvalu are addressed in the theories regarding migration into the Pacific that began about <a0_0>3000 years<a0_0/> ago. During pre-European-contact times there was frequent <a1_0>canoe<a1_0/> voyaging between the nearer islands including Samoa and Tonga. <a3_0>Eight<a3_0/> of the <a2_0>nine islands<a2_0/> of Tuvalu were inhabited; thus the name, Tuvalu, means "<a4_0>eight standing together<a4_0/>" in Tuvaluan (compare to *walo meaning "eight" in Proto-Austronesian). Possible evidence of fire in the Caves of Nanumanga may indicate human occupation for thousands of years.
